title: The Walking Dead season 10: Will Carol and Daryl leave together? We’re scared
text:
Will Daryl and Carol leaver The Walking Dead together? (Picture: AMC)

Everyone’s favourite zombie-fighting buddies, Daryl and Carol, finally got reunited in the premiere of The Walking Dead season 10. But is the show’s endgame on the way, and could the two survivors actually leave together?

Carol (Melissa McBride) finally returned to the zombie apocalypse after months away at sea, and it was pretty clear from the off that both she and Daryl (Norman Reedus) are now tired of fighting.

After the loss of Henry, who was murdered by the Whisperers leader Alpha (Samantha Morton), we saw the series stalwart consider running away, with her best friend joining her.

The besties reunited in the premiere for The Walking Dead season 10 (Picture: AMC)

‘You ever wonder if this is all there is?’ Carol asked Daryl. ‘Just run into people, kill each other until whoever’s left says enough?’

‘No more fighting,’ Daryl replied. ‘Just get on the bike and go. See who’s left.’

If audiences are wondering if the two could actually leave the show, they maybe should be legitimately worried. In the past few seasons, the AMC hit hasn’t held back when it comes to the exits of its main stars. Andrew Lincoln’s Rick Grimes – The Walking Dead’s head honcho – has left to kickstart his own movie series and we’re coming ever closer to Danai Gurira’s last scenes as Michonne, which will apparently come with ‘massive’ consequences.

The duo have been pulled back into conflict with The Whisperers (Picture: AMC)

Norman has already spoken out on the possibility of Daryl and Carol leaving the road, especially now since the war-weary duo have been pulled back into conflict with the Whisperers.

The actor told Entertainment Weekly: ‘Life is so hard sometimes, especially on that show for those characters. They say, “What if we did this?” They’re kind of daydreaming about stuff. We’re kind of window-shopping opportunities. I think it’s what you would do. You’d be, “Meh, I just wish things would be different right now.” So it’s two friends doing that. Sparking a little openness to them.’

Although as they say, when one door closes another must open and Maggie (Lauren Cohan) is definitely returning for the new season.
